location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.4787 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter relates to Kemball's earlier enquiry (folio 343) over whether Acts of Parliament stipulating the head money payable for captured slaves from the Arab coast, applies also to slaves captured on the Persian coast. Malet writes that he regrets the head money cannot be paid for those slaves captured from Persian boats, but that the issue will be referred to the Honourable Court of Directors.
